author: MSNBC.com
title: Europe suppressed the coronavirus. The U.S. has not.
description: Chris Hayes: “The last refuge for comparison…was Europe. And it was a way for making ourselves feel better about how we were dealing with the virus. But now that is clearly gone. Europe has suppressed the virus and we have not.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Magically protected’: Why hardcore Trump supporters won’t wear masks at rally
description: “It’s not going to touch you at the rally,” author Jeff Sharlet says of hardcore Trump supporters’ belief in the divinity and “spiritual protection” of a Trump rally against coronavirus, “You’ll be sort of magically protected.”

title: ‘Actively suppressed’: How the 1921 Tulsa Massacre was erased...

title: DOJ tries to oust U.S. Attorney who led probe of Trump associates

title: Trump stacks US media agency with loyalists led by Bannon acolyte

title: Tulsa’s weekend of contrasts: Juneteenth commemorations Friday, MAGA rally on Saturday

author: MSNBC.com
title: Al Gore: Poverty and systemic racism are 'tightly linked with the climate crisis'

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Lieu: Protester arrested outside Trump rally 'was not doing anything wrong'
description: Rep. Ted Lieu, D-Calif., commented on the arrest of a protester outside of the arena President Trump will be holding a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, saying she "was not doing anything wrong." The congressman added "Republicans talk about free speech all the time …

author: MSNBC.com
title: Padma Lakshmi: ‘Immigrants are the future of our country’
description: Padma Lakshmi, host of Hulu’s “Taste the Nation with Padma Lakshmi,” challenges anti-immigration politicians to embed in the communities their laws affect.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Systemic racism is ‘the privilege you enjoy because of the color of your skin'
description: Oklahoma state Rep. Monroe Nichols says past racism, such as the massacre of Black Tulsa residents, continues to benefit white Americans.

author: MSNBC.com
title: National Constitution Center pres.: ‘The Supreme Court hasn’t become a liberal court by any stretch of the imagination'
description: National Constitution Center president and CEO Jeffrey Rosen explains that the conservative Supreme Court justices are guided by Constitutional methodologies, not “pure politics” as Trump expected.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Kimberlé Crenshaw: Black women killed by police are seen as ‘collateral damage’
description: Columbia Law professor and African American Policy Forum executive director Kimberlé Crenshaw, whose organization created the #SayHerName campaign, says Black women are often blamed for their own deaths at the hands of police.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: Police unions, stop protecting the racists in your ranks
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi says police unions should keep their members accountable to the public.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'I have tickets': Police arrest protester outside Trump rally arena in Tulsa
description: NBC News' Morgan Chesky reports as a protester is arrested by police for trespassing at the arena where President Trump will be holding a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma. The protester claimed she had tickets for the event.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Judge denies Trump administration's request to block Bolton's book
description: A federal judge has ruled that former national security adviser John Bolton will be allowed to publish his book, denying the Trump administration's attempts to block it. NBC News' Josh Lederman reports from the White House.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Lawyers on why prosecuting police who kill wrongfully is tough
description: Reforming police departments and holding officers accountable who wrongfully kill is still very challenging our panel of legal experts explains to Joy Reid.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Legal experts on Barr misstating Manhattan US attorney resigning
description: U.S. Attorney General William Barr misstated that Manhattan U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman was resigning, resulting in Berman immediately responding that he is not resigning. Why did this occur? Joy Reid and her legal panel of experts discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump’s Tulsa rally one day after Juneteenth still irks voters
description: Donald Trump’s Tulsa, Oklahoma rally during Juneteenth weekend is still seen as slight by many according to reports, even though rally planners moved the date due to a backlash. Joy Reid and her panel discuss the many diverse Americans who have come to apprec…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Six members of Trump's Tulsa advance team test positive for coronavirus
description: Six members of President Trump's advance team for his rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma have tested positive for coronavirus. NBC News' Josh Lederman reports from the White House.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mothers of Eric Garner, Amadou Diallo on police reform movement
description: Today’s Black Live Matter protests and the concurrent calls for police reform are discussed by the mothers of Eric Garner and Amadou Diallo, Gwen Carr and Kadiatou Diallo, in conversation with Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Cory Booker on bills on exploring reparations, more
description: Reparations and Juneteenth holiday bills introduced by Sen. Cory Booker and more are explained to Joy Reid, in addition to the larger need for America to address the aspects of its history that include racial violence.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Texas Congresswoman Sylvia Garcia on missing Fort Hood soldier, Vanessa Guillen
description: Texas congresswoman Sylvia Garcia sits down with MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez to discuss the latest on missing solder, Private First Class Vanessa Guillen, including allegations that she was sexually harassed at Fort Hood prior to her disappearance.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'We are in a battle collectively around who gets to survive and thrive in America': The fight continues after SCOTUS DACA ruling
description: Hundreds of thousands of DACA recipients celebrated a moment of relief after the Supreme Court ruling prevented the Trump administration from ending the program, but the fight isn’t over. As polls find increasing support for Dreamers to be allowed to stay in …

author: MSNBC.com
title: Journalist and activist on Trump Tulsa rally amid BLM protests

author: MSNBC.com
title: AG Barr tells Manhattan U.S. Attorney Berman in a letter that he's been fired
description: Attorney General William Barr writes a letter to Manhattan U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman saying that he has asked President Trump to "remove" him from his position.

title: 'The fire has been ignited': DC protesters call for systemic change over performance activism

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump campaign cancels outdoor events ahead of Tulsa rally amid low turnout
description: The Trump campaign canceled the outdoor events it planned ahead of President Trump's first rally in months amid a tense political backdrop, anti-racism protests and the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. John Lewis documentary ‘Good Trouble’ promotes voting
description: On Juneteenth, the voting rights-focused, new documentary  ‘Good Trouble’ featuring Rep. John Lewis made its premiere. Actor, activist, and producer Erika Alexander of Color Farm Media, which co-developed the project, joins Joy Reid to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC
